image.title: The latest news from News Center.

item.title: Getting to Know Your Status – US immigration overview – rescheduled to April 22
item.creator: vstanley
item.description: The Visa Office will conduct a general overview of the US Immigration, presenting the information relevant to many international visitors and employees at Fermilab. This will be the first and most general in the series of increasingly detailed seminars, which will include presentations by the Visa Office staff and some outside immigration attorneys. Light refreshments will be provided. Please RSVP to the Visa Office at visaoffice@fnal.gov by Friday, April 15th.
item.comment:
The Visa Office will conduct a general overview of the US Immigration, presenting the information relevant to many international visitors and employees at Fermilab. This will be the first and most general in the series of increasingly detailed seminars, which will include presentations by the Visa Office staff and some outside immigration attorneys. Light refreshments will be provided.

Please RSVP to the Visa Office at visaoffice@fnal.gov by Friday, April 15th.

item.title: Small Group Training registration due March 28
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: Small Group Training is a semi-private session in which a group of three individuals will train together under the guidance and supervision of a personal trainer to reach their goals in the most effective way possible. There are two Small Group Training classes offered. There is a 4pm class and a 5:30pm class. This class will be held twice a week on Mondays & Wednesdays, April 4 – May 26 from 4:00-4:45pm or 5:30-6:15pm. Choose the time slot that works... More »
item.comment:
Small Group Training is a semi-private session in which a group of three individuals will train together under the guidance and supervision of a personal trainer to reach their goals in the most effective way possible.

There are two Small Group Training classes offered. There is a 4pm class and a 5:30pm class. This class will be held twice a week on Mondays & Wednesdays, April 4 – May 26 from 4:00-4:45pm or 5:30-6:15pm. Choose the time slot that works best for you. This class will meet in the Fitness Center and utilize the weight room and exercise room. Fee is $275 for 16 sessions of semi-private training.

Register by March 28th in the Wellness Office, WH15W. For more info call Jeanne in the Wellness Office at jecker@fnal.gov or x2548. http://wdrs.fnal.gov/wellness/classes.html

item.title: Fit Camp registration due March 28
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: Fit Camp is the perfect class for all fitness levels focusing on full body conditioning. Through the implementation of body weight exercises and weighted movements, participants will see improvements in strength and endurance while increasing mobility and flexibility. Time to change your body and impact your metabolism! Class will be held twice a week on Mondays & Wednesdays, April 4 – May 26 from 4:45pm-5:30pm at the Fitness Center Exercise Room. Fee is $140 for 16 sessions. Register by March... More »
item.comment:
Fit Camp is the perfect class for all fitness levels focusing on full body conditioning. Through the implementation of body weight exercises and weighted movements, participants will see improvements in strength and endurance while increasing mobility and flexibility. Time to change your body and impact your metabolism!

Class will be held twice a week on Mondays & Wednesdays, April 4 – May 26 from 4:45pm-5:30pm at the Fitness Center Exercise Room. Fee is $140 for 16 sessions. Register by March 28th in the Wellness Office, WH15W. For more info call Jeanne in the Wellness Office at jecker@fnal.gov or x2548. http://wdrs.fnal.gov/wellness/classes.html

item.title: Cosmic Web is featured in Fermilab Art Gallery
item.creator: Rashmi
item.description: "The Cosmic Web" by X depicts the distribution of matter in our universe, both dark and visible.
item.comment: “The Cosmic Web” by Benedikt Diemer and James Wetzel depicts the distribution of matter in our universe, both dark and visible. It is visible in the “Art of Darkness” exhibit in the Fermilab Art Gallery. Photo: Rashmi Shivni

item.title: First Fermilab badminton tournament [photo]
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: Fermilab Badminton held its first tournament on March 12.
item.comment:
Fermilab Badminton held its first tournament on March 12, 2016.

Fermilab Badminton held its first tournament on March 12. There were 30 highly energetic participants from Fermilab who played more than 70 games in four different categories. The event ran for five hours and was followed by delicious refreshments from Asian and American cuisines.

The event was sponsored by FSPA and the Fermilab Wellness Office. The group regularly plays every Wednesday and Friday at 4:30 p.m. in the Fermilab Gymnasium. Please join them to boost your badminton skill and be part of a fun-loving multicultural group. Gym membership required. Contact nur@fnal.gov for more details.

item.title: Rattan for sale
item.creator: shandvi
item.description: Pier 1 rattan (not plastic!) chair with new cushion/pillows, good condition (some scratches on finish), $50.00. No delivery – would need to be picked up in Geneva. Contact Seton Handville, qigonghappiness@gmail.com
item.comment: Pier 1 rattan (not plastic!) chair with new cushion/pillows, good condition (some scratches on finish), $50.00. No delivery – would need to be picked up in Geneva. Contact Seton Handville, qigonghappiness@gmail.com

item.title: Lunch & Learn: What You Can Do to Manage Your Arthritis
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: Attend this free Wellness Lunch & Learn for people with arthritis and the people who care about them. Meet experts in arthritis care who will inform you about current scientific evidence and management strategies in the treatment and care of osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile arthritis. Tuesday, March 29, 2016 from 12 to 1 p.m. in Wilson Hall, Curia II, 2nd floor. RSVP jecker@fnal.gov or call x2548.
item.comment: Attend this free Wellness Lunch & Learn for people with arthritis and the people who care about them. Meet experts in arthritis care who will inform you about current scientific evidence and management strategies in the treatment and care of osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and juvenile arthritis. Tuesday, March 29, 2016 from 12 to 1 p.m. in Wilson Hall, Curia II, 2nd floor. RSVP jecker@fnal.gov or call x2548.

item.title: Crayfish out for a walk
item.creator: bjorkqur
item.description: This sweet little creature, which is carrying a load of just-hatched babies underneath its tail, was spotted on the bike path last week.
item.comment: This sweet little creature, which is carrying a load of just-hatched babies underneath its tail, was spotted on the bike path last week. Photo: Robin Bjorkquist, Cornell University

item.title: No prescription safety eyewear Wednesday, March 23
item.creator: leah
item.description: Attention prescription safety eyewear customers: Please be advised that the eye technician will not be on site Wednesday, March 23. Normal service will resume on Wednesday, March 30.
item.comment: Attention prescription safety eyewear customers: Please be advised that the eye technician will not be on site Wednesday, March 23. Normal service will resume on Wednesday, March 30.
